results.title: Alpine Playground
results.creator_credit: Tourist Development Authority of Victoria and Cinesound
results.brief_description: A holiday with a difference; the joys of an alpine winter holiday in Victoria’s picturesque skiing resorts, Mt Buffalo, Mt Hotham and Falls Creek. Within easy reach of Melbourne, facilities include expert ski instruction, readily available ski tows, toboggans, and comfortable accommodation.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tourist Development Authority of Victoria and Cinesound
results.description: A holiday with a difference; the joys of an alpine winter holiday in Victoria’s picturesque skiing resorts, Mt Buffalo, Mt Hotham and Falls Creek. Within easy reach of Melbourne, facilities include expert ski instruction, readily available ski tows, toboggans, and comfortable accommodation.
description_for_label: A holiday with a difference; the joys of an alpine winter holiday in Victoria’s picturesque skiing resorts, Mt Buffalo, Mt Hotham and Falls Creek. Within easy reach of Melbourne, facilities include expert ski instruction, readily available ski tows, toboggans, and comfortable accommodation.

results.title: Where Do I Belong?
results.creator_credit: Rita el-Khoury, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Rita el-Khoury travels to Lebanon every year. She calls Australia and Lebanon her home but it wasn’t until she was caught in the middle of the 2006 Israeli bombing of Beiruit that she fully appreciated what that meant.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rita el-Khoury, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: The Spaces in Between
results.creator_credit: Carla Pascoe, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Carla Pascoe traces her family’s ancestry from Lebanon and contemplates the mysterious circumstances of her great grandfather’s migration, as well as the undocumented moments of her family’s history.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Carla Pascoe, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Carla Pascoe traces her family’s ancestry from Lebanon and contemplates the mysterious circumstances of her great grandfather’s migration, as well as the undocumented moments of her family’s history.

results.title: Aboriginal canoe trees of the Murray
results.creator_credit: Robert Edwards, South Australian Museum and Australian Institute of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Studies
results.brief_description: Aborigines of the lower Murray River formerly made large canoes from the bark of Red Gum trees. This film documents the felling of a canoe tree from the sides of the Murray and its transportation to the South Australian Museum for preservation.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Edwards, South Australian Museum and Australian Institute of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Studies
results.description: Aborigines of the lower Murray River formerly made large canoes from the bark of Red Gum trees. This film documents the felling of a canoe tree from the sides of the Murray and its transportation to the South Australian Museum for preservation.
description_for_label: Aborigines of the lower Murray River formerly made large canoes from the bark of Red Gum trees. This film documents the felling of a canoe tree from the sides of the Murray and its transportation to the South Australian Museum for preservation.

results.title: Fifty Years of Service
results.creator_credit: Shan Benson and State Electricity Commission of Victoria
results.brief_description: The first fifty years of the State Electricity Commission is presented by means of archival film detailing highlights of the development of the power authority for Victoria - from 1919 to the completion of the giant Hazelwood power complex.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Shan Benson and State Electricity Commission of Victoria

results.title: The Affliction of Memory
results.creator_credit: Zeina Zogheib, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: For Zeina Zogheib the aroma of coffee and the fragrant scent of gardenia bring memories of Lebanon flooding back. A place Zeina and her family fled, due to the ravages of war.

results.title: Loving Lebanon and Australia
results.creator_credit: Sam Haddad, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Lebanese immigrant Sam Haddad migrated to Australia he encountered ignorance and racism but via a well timed punch, he learned the value of mateship and tolerance and began to love his adopted country.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sam Haddad, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: [Big Melbourne]
results.creator_credit: State Film Centre of Victoria and Malcolm Wallhead
results.brief_description: Possible State Film Centre production. Shows a woman and her son on a journey through Melbourne’s central business district, including Flinders Street train station, St Paul’s Cathedral, shopping at Myer. Also features footage of ships and boats.
results.creator_credit_for_label: State Film Centre of Victoria and Malcolm Wallhead

results.title: Beneath our feet. Parts 1-3
results.creator_credit: Bob Scarfe and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description: The Scenery of Victoria looks at the landforms throughout the state and relates the actual location to its geological significance. “Geological history of Victoria” Very similar to Part 1, but made for year 10 science with more emphasis on the period of history each geological type fits into. “Granite” looks at the formation and coding processes that produce granite with emphasis on the seven types of rocks that are currently associated with granite.
results.description: The Scenery of Victoria looks at the landforms throughout the state and relates the actual location to its geological significance. “Geological history of Victoria” Very similar to Part 1, but made for year 10 science with more emphasis on the period of history each geological type fits into. “Granite” looks at the formation and coding processes that produce granite with emphasis on the seven types of rocks that are currently associated with granite.
